headline: Global tech shares surge as Nvidia's AI boom powers market rally
summary: (Reuters) -Global technology shares rallied on Thursday after Nvidia's blow-out quarterly results signalled that demand for artificial intelligence hardware remains strong even as analysts caution the boom may be outpacing ​fundamentals.  The chip bellwether's stellar results tempered some concerns over a potential AI bubble, although questions lingered around the sustainability of ‌the massive spending boom not paying off as anticipated.  Nvidia is on track to add about $243 billion to its market cap, which is more than entire valuation of companies ‌such as PepsiCo, and Goldman Sachs, if gains hold, with shares up 5% at $196.53 in premarket trading.

content.title: Global tech shares surge as Nvidia's AI boom powers market rally
content.summary: (Reuters) -Global technology shares rallied on Thursday after Nvidia's blow-out quarterly results signalled that demand for artificial intelligence hardware remains strong even as analysts caution the boom may be outpacing ​fundamentals.  The chip bellwether's stellar results tempered some concerns over a potential AI bubble, although questions lingered around the sustainability of ‌the massive spending boom not paying off as anticipated.  Nvidia is on track to add about $243 billion to its market cap, which is more than entire valuation of companies ‌such as PepsiCo, and Goldman Sachs, if gains hold, with shares up 5% at $196.53 in premarket trading.

headline: Why Nvidia earnings are boosting these four stocks
summary: Nvidia (NVDA)'s Q3 earnings beat has lifted stocks across the tech sector, including competitors such as Intel (INTC), AMD (AMD) and Broadcom (AVGO). But there are four stocks (000660.KS, 005930.KS, MU, TSM) that are particularly closely linked to Nvidia - and benefitting from its strong performance. Ramzan Karmali explains. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Is Micron’s Soaring 158% Rally in 2025 Missing Key Valuation Risks?
summary: Thinking of buying Micron Technology but wondering if it's a good deal right now? You are not alone, as the company's value is a hot topic among investors. Even after a 7.8% drop over the past week, the stock is up an incredible 158.7% so far this year and has delivered 130.6% returns over the last 12 months. This wild ride comes on the back of a major surge of interest in semiconductor and AI-related stocks, with Micron regularly making headlines for its role in next-generation memory...

headline: ASML launches technical academy in Phoenix to train in-demand engineers
summary: PHOENIX (Reuters) -Chip equipment maker ASML on Thursday launched a technical academy in Phoenix to train engineers to service the Dutch ​company's complex chipmaking machines.  Located within a few minutes of the Phoenix airport,‌ the facility is designed to train more than 1,000 engineers a year to repair and service ASML’s chipmaking ‌tools.  ASML decided to open the academy because of the significant increase in advanced chip manufacturing in the United States.

content.title: ASML launches technical academy in Phoenix to train in-demand engineers
content.summary: PHOENIX (Reuters) -Chip equipment maker ASML on Thursday launched a technical academy in Phoenix to train engineers to service the Dutch ​company's complex chipmaking machines.  Located within a few minutes of the Phoenix airport,‌ the facility is designed to train more than 1,000 engineers a year to repair and service ASML’s chipmaking ‌tools.  ASML decided to open the academy because of the significant increase in advanced chip manufacturing in the United States.

headline: Global tech shares falter as Nvidia-led rally stalls
summary: (Reuters) -U.S. technology stocks failed to hold on their initial gains on Thursday, as a rally driven by Nvidia ran out of steam with concerns of lofty valuations in the technology space coming back to ​the fore.  Nvidia's shares were last down 2.2% after surging 5% earlier in the day when its stellar results tempered some concerns over ‌a potential AI bubble, although questions about the payoff from the massive spending boom remain.  "The people who are selling the semiconductors to help power AI doesn't alleviate the concerns that some of these hyperscalers are spending way too much money on building the AI infrastructure," said Robert Pavlik, senior portfolio manager at Dakota Wealth.

content.title: Global tech shares falter as Nvidia-led rally stalls
content.summary: (Reuters) -U.S. technology stocks failed to hold on their initial gains on Thursday, as a rally driven by Nvidia ran out of steam with concerns of lofty valuations in the technology space coming back to ​the fore.  Nvidia's shares were last down 2.2% after surging 5% earlier in the day when its stellar results tempered some concerns over ‌a potential AI bubble, although questions about the payoff from the massive spending boom remain.  "The people who are selling the semiconductors to help power AI doesn't alleviate the concerns that some of these hyperscalers are spending way too much money on building the AI infrastructure," said Robert Pavlik, senior portfolio manager at Dakota Wealth.

headline: Stock Market Today: Indexes Dragged As Nvidia Stock Turns Red; Tech ETFs Slump (Live Coverage)
summary: A major earnings victory for artificial intelligence giant Nvidia propelled its shares higher Thursday before its gains turned to losses, prompting the Dow Jones Industrial Average and other stock indexes to fall sharply.  The market's reversal came even though Wall Street's key gauges found robust support on the stock market today from a long-delayed jobs report.  Nvidia initially ran up 5% to a session high of 196, but the stock eventually fell more than 4%.

content.title: Stock Market Today: Indexes Dragged As Nvidia Stock Turns Red; Tech ETFs Slump (Live Coverage)
content.summary: A major earnings victory for artificial intelligence giant Nvidia propelled its shares higher Thursday before its gains turned to losses, prompting the Dow Jones Industrial Average and other stock indexes to fall sharply.  The market's reversal came even though Wall Street's key gauges found robust support on the stock market today from a long-delayed jobs report.  Nvidia initially ran up 5% to a session high of 196, but the stock eventually fell more than 4%.
